net.proteusframework.internet.http

Interface Response


  • public interface Response
    Interface for a server response.
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • addCookie

        void addCookie(Cookie cookie)
        Add a cookie to the response.
        Parameters:
        cookie - the cookie.

      • addHeader

        void addHeader(String headerName,
             String headerValue)
        Set a header to be returned to the client. The header must begin with "X-".
        Parameters:
        headerName - the name.
        headerValue - the value.

      • createURL

        ResponseURL createURL()
        Create a URL that targets the current page.
        Returns:
        the URL.

      • createURL

        ResponseURL createURL(boolean targetMe)
        Create a URL that targets the current page and optionally the content that being generated by this response.
        Parameters:
        targetMe - true or false.
        Returns:
        the URL.

      • createURL

        ResponseURL createURL(Link link)
        Create a URL to the specified Link.
        Parameters:
        link - the link.
        Returns:
        the URL.

      • createURL

        ResponseURL createURL(RequestPath requestPath)
                      throws IllegalArgumentException
        Create a URL to the specified RequestPath.
        Parameters:
        requestPath - the request path.
        Returns:
        the URL.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the RequestPath URI is invalid.

      • createURL

        ResponseURL createURL(String uri)
                      throws IllegalArgumentException
        Create a URL.
        Parameters:
        uri - the uri.
        Returns:
        creates a new Link and returns the value from calling createURL(Link).
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the URI is invalid.
        See Also:
        createURL(Link)

      • encodeURL

        String encodeURL(String url)
        Encode the URL with a session ID if necessary.
        Parameters:
        url - the url.
        Returns:
        the encoded URL.

      • getContentWriter

        net.proteusframework.core.io.EntityUtilWriter getContentWriter()
                                                               throws IllegalStateException
        Get writer for data content.

        You can call either getOutputStream() or getContentWriter(), not both.

        Returns:
        the writer.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if getOutputStream() has already been called.

      • getOutputStream

        OutputStream getOutputStream()
                             throws IllegalStateException
        Get the output stream.

        You can call either getOutputStream() or getContentWriter(), not both.

        Returns:
        the output stream.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if getContentWriter() has already been called.

      • hasRetrievedContentWriter

        boolean hasRetrievedContentWriter()
        Test if the content writer has been retrieved.

        hasRetrievedContentWriter() can be true or hasRetrievedOutputStream() can be true, but not both. They can both be false if neither has been retrieved or the content writer has been overridden.

        Returns:
        true if the output stream has been retrieved.

      • hasRetrievedOutputStream

        boolean hasRetrievedOutputStream()
        Test if the output stream has been retrieved.

        hasRetrievedContentWriter() can be true or hasRetrievedOutputStream() can be true, but not both. They can both be false if neither has been retrieved or the content writer has been overridden.

        Returns:
        true if the output stream has been retrieved.

      • isCommitted

        boolean isCommitted()
        Test if the response has been committed. Responses may be buffered and this method can be used to determine if any data has been sent to the client. If the response is not committed, then calls to setStatus(ResponseStatus), redirect(ResponseURL), etc, may succeed.
        Returns:
        true or false.

      • isInRedirect

        boolean isInRedirect()
        Return true if in redirect.
        Returns:
        true or false.

      • redirect

        void redirect(RequestPath path)
              throws IllegalStateException
        Send a redirect to the request path. The redirect type is chosen automatically. This is a convenience method that calls redirect(ResponseURL).
        Parameters:
        path - the path. May be null. If null, no redirect occurs.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the requested path cannot be constructed for redirection.

      • redirect

        void redirect(ResponseURL url)
              throws IllegalStateException
        Redirect to the specified URL. The redirect type is chosen automatically. This should be called in the processing phase. It may be too late if called in the rendering phase.
        Parameters:
        url - the URL.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if called in the rendering phase.

      • redirect

        void redirect(ResponseURL url,
            RedirectType redirectType)
              throws IllegalStateException
        Redirect to the specified URL. This should be called in the processing phase. It may be too late if called in the rendering phase.
        Parameters:
        url - the URL.
        redirectType - the redirect type.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if called in the rendering phase.

      • redirectForSSLIfNeeded

        boolean redirectForSSLIfNeeded()
        Redirect for SSL if needed.
        Returns:
        true if the redirect was performed; otherwise false.

      • sendError

        void sendError(RequestError re,
             String msg)
               throws IllegalStateException
        Send an error.
        Parameters:
        re - request error.
        msg - optional message.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the response is already committed. This will commit the response.

      • sendError

        void sendError(ResponseError re,
             String msg)
               throws IllegalStateException
        Send an error.
        Parameters:
        re - response error.
        msg - optional message.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the response is already committed. This will commit the response.

      • sendErrorCode

        void sendErrorCode(int code,
                 String msg)
                   throws IllegalStateException
        Send an error.
        Parameters:
        code - request/response error.
        msg - optional message.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the response is already committed. This will commit the response.

      • setCookie

        void setCookie(String name,
             String value,
             int seconds)
        Set a cookie.

        This sets a cookie without a path. User agents use the "directory" of the request URI path as the default value.

        See RFC 6265 for more information.

        Parameters:
        name - the name.
        value - the value.
        seconds - the number of seconds to store the cookie.

      • setCookie

        void setCookie(String name,
             String value,
             String path,
             int seconds)
        Set a cookie.

        See RFC 6265 for more information.

        Parameters:
        path - an optional path that determines the scope of the cookie.
        name - the name.
        value - the value.
        seconds - the number of seconds to store the cookie.

      • setHeader

        void setHeader(String headerName,
             String headerValue)
        Set a header to be returned to the client. The header must begin with "X-".
        Parameters:
        headerName - the name.
        headerValue - the value.

      • setStatus

        void setStatus(ResponseStatus status)
        Set the response status. This only needs to be called if the status is something other than ResponseStatus.OK which is the default. For errors, call sendError(RequestError, String) to ensure that the response is properly reset and for redirects, call one of the redirect methods.
        Parameters:
        status - the status.

      • setStatusCode

        void setStatusCode(int statusCode)
        Set the status code. This is similar to setStatus(ResponseStatus) except that any status code can be set.
        Parameters:
        statusCode - a status code.
